text:
Under the Americans with Disabilities Act, you can ask for reasonable accommodations for your mental health challenges. If you have an HR department, you can work with them and your manager to figure out what will help you the most while not impacting your team in a negative way (maybe flexible work hours, work-from-home days if struggling in the office, days with no meetings, etc.) You can also take unpaid time off via FMLA (assuming you’ve been employed there for over a year), and it doesn’t have to be a huge chunk of time; it can literally be a day or two, I believe.

You can also find an advocate to help you navigate this process (ask your doctor to start; there are probably many online and/or local resources, and your insurance company MAY be able to help)>

I’ve been pretty outspoken about my mental health for the last 5 or so years. With one exception (a manager that literally said, “I was depressed once; you just need to get out of bed and get moving” :face_with_rolling_eyes: I’ve had nothing but support and, in many cases, other co-workers feeling ‘safe’ to express their own challenges, on whatever level.

You are always your own best advocate; your first concern should be what is best for you, acknowledging where YOUR comfort zone is, and being kind to yourself when you have a bad day (or week or month).

Feel free to DM me if you ever want to talk in more details, and best of luck to you!
